body:
Dear Kam,



This posting might be better suited for the DIVA-for-Rhino forum
(http://groups.google.com/group/diva-for-rhino) but maybe
GenCumulativeSky is also of interest to some on the general Radiance
list. The program was written by Darren Robinson and generated a
cumulative sky for annual or monthly radiation maps . There are similar
methods available by Francesco Anselmo and John Mardaljevic.



The program is started with:



GenCumulativeSky +s1 -a 45 -o 76 -m 75 -r -E -time 0 24 -date 1 1 12 31
epw_file > Gund_111.cal



You could try to debug your epw file from Singapore using the command
line. We are actually working on a project in Singapore right now and
the local file worked for us.



Christoph





[mailto:radiance-general-bounces@radiance-online.org] On Behalf Of Kam
Shing Leung
Sent: Monday, November 29, 2010 5:58 AM
To: radiance-general@radiance-online.org



Dear all,



I have tried to use the GenCumulativeSky.exe programme made available
through Diva for Rhino v1.1f.



When I ran the programme on a DOS command line, it said:



**

Error opening: SGP_Singapore.486980_IWEC.epw

GenCumulativeSky: Error reading climate file
SGP_Singapore.486980_IWEC.epw

**



I tried it with the San Francisco .epw file as well but it also didn't
work.



Could anyone advise how it can be solved?



Also, may I know what it means by "hourshift" in the -h entry?



Thanks a lot!



Cheers,

Kam
